Analytical Instrumentation Standards
Introduction
Analytical instruments provide on‑line measurement of process composition and quality parameters such as pH, conductivity, dissolved oxygen, turbidity, sulphur and gas composition. High‑quality analysers enable continuous control of product specifications and environmental compliance. These standards integrate guidance from API 551 and ISA 5.1, along with detailed specifications for turbidity, pH and dissolved oxygen systems【51948133245220†L4037-L4149】.
Applicable Standards
API 551 – Analytical Instrumentation.
ISA 5.1 and ISA 20: symbols and data sheets.
ASTM D1785: sample system materials.
ISO 15859 / ISO 2186: sampling lines and sample probes.
EPA and ASTM methods for measurement of specific analytes (e.g., ASTM D664 for acid number).
Equipment Types
Gas chromatographs (GCs): on‑line gas chromatographs for hydrocarbon composition, BTU and distillation curves; field‑mounted with shelter; integrated with sample conditioning systems.
